reviewText: I have seen 3 versions of Anna and the King Deborah  Kerr Jodie Foster and Irene Dunne this was my favorite
Was fooled thinking "Anna and the King" was Blu-ray! So I now have 2 standard DVD's for that movie.

If you do not have these two movies I feel sorry for you. They are both wonderful films with wonderful actors and actress's. I have always loved Rex Harrison and Irene Dunne. But, Chow Yun Fat and Jodie Foster did right by them on the remake.
refreshing to have non sex filled movie, the depiction of the violent deaths were the only turn off
I really enjoyed the actors the costumes and the honesty of the story. The beauty of the scenery. I watch it a lot.
Enjoyed the movie. Receive the movie as promise.

The first "Anna" was almost quaint in its focus and use of caucasions in the role of the Siamese people.  I enjoyed it, but truly liked the newer "Anna and the King"  more because it felt more real.  Both Chow Yun Fat and Jodie Foster are terrific in their roles.  I was also surprised to see Tom Felton as "Louis".  I am more used to seeing him as Drako Malfoy in the Harry Potter movies.
Good movies.  I did not like the newer version as much as the older one.  It makes you look at the map and think about the country.
I love the original and new version. They both make a lovely point about love and life. I love Jody Foster.
